title: Fix missing Mission image asset and add Mission image fallback UI

requirements.summary: Ensure the Mission section image static asset exists at the exact MISSION_IMAGE_PATH and is served by the frontend build.
acceptanceCriteria: The file `frontend/public/assets/generated/img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg` exists in the repo and is included in the deployed frontend build output as a static asset.
Requesting `GET /assets/generated/img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg` returns HTTP 200 and the image bytes.
The image renders on the Home page Mission section without broken-image behavior.

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded Mission image file at the exact path referenced by `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` so the bundler serves it as a static asset. IMPORTANT: do not modify/recompress/resize/convert/rename the image bytes; place the file exactly as-is at this path.
Verify `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` remains the single source of truth and matches `/assets/generated/img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg` exactly (including casing and leading slash).

requirements.summary: Add client-side error handling so the Mission image shows an in-page English fallback message if it fails to load.
acceptanceCriteria: If the Mission image fails to load (e.g., by temporarily changing `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` to an invalid path), the Home page displays a visible fallback message in place of the image.
If the Mission image loads successfully, no fallback message is shown and the layout remains unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the Mission section `` to track load errors (e.g., via React state + `onError`) and conditionally render a clear in-page English fallback message in place of the image when loading fails, while keeping the current layout unchanged when the image loads successfully.
